user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.14 is: The Standard Library function memcmp shall not be used to compare null terminated strings.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_quiesce_daemon:
```c
_MHD_EXTERN MHD_socket
MHD_quiesce_daemon (struct MHD_Daemon *daemon)
{
#if defined(MHD_USE_POSIX_THREADS) || defined(MHD_USE_W32_THREADS)
  unsigned int i;
#endif
  MHD_socket ret;

  ret = daemon->listen_fd;
  if ((MHD_INVALID_SOCKET == ret)
      || daemon->was_quiesced)
    return MHD_INVALID_SOCKET;
  if ( (0 == (daemon->options & (MHD_USE_ITC))) &&
       MHD_D_IS_USING_THREADS_ (daemon) )
  {
#ifdef HAVE_MESSAGES
    MHD_DLOG (daemon,
              _ ("Using MHD_quiesce_daemon in this mode " \
                 "requires MHD_USE_ITC.\n"));
#endif
    return MHD_INVALID_SOCKET;
  }

#if defined(MHD_USE_POSIX_THREADS) || defined(MHD_USE_W32_THREADS)
  if (NULL != daemon->worker_pool)
    for (i = 0; i < daemon->worker_pool_size; i++)
    {
      daemon->worker_pool[i].was_quiesced = true;
#ifdef EPOLL_SUPPORT
      if (MHD_D_IS_USING_EPOLL_ (daemon) &&
          (-1 != daemon->worker_pool[i].epoll_fd) &&
          (daemon->worker_pool[i].listen_socket_in_epoll) )
      {
        if (0 != epoll_ctl (daemon->worker_pool[i].epoll_fd,
                            EPOLL_CTL_DEL,
                            ret,
                            NULL))
          MHD_PANIC (_ ("Failed to remove listen FD from epoll set.\n"));
        daemon->worker_pool[i].listen_socket_in_epoll = false;
      }
      else
#endif
      if (MHD_ITC_IS_VALID_ (daemon->worker_pool[i].itc))
      {
        if (! MHD_itc_activate_ (daemon->worker_pool[i].itc, "q"))
          MHD_PANIC (_ ("Failed to signal quiesce via inter-thread " \
                        "communication channel.\n"));
      }
    }
#endif
  daemon->was_quiesced = true;
#ifdef EPOLL_SUPPORT
  if (MHD_D_IS_USING_EPOLL_ (daemon) &&
      (-1 != daemon->epoll_fd) &&
      (daemon->listen_socket_in_epoll) )
  {
    if ( (0 != epoll_ctl (daemon->epoll_fd,
                          EPOLL_CTL_DEL,
                          ret,
                          NULL)) &&
         (ENOENT != errno) )   /* ENOENT can happen due to race with
                                  #MHD_epoll() */
      MHD_PANIC ("Failed to remove listen FD from epoll set.\n");
    daemon->listen_socket_in_epoll = false;
  }
#endif
  if ( (MHD_ITC_IS_VALID_ (daemon->itc)) &&
       (! MHD_itc_activate_ (daemon->itc, "q")) )
    MHD_PANIC (_ ("failed to signal quiesce via inter-thread " \
                  "communication channel.\n"));
  return ret;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function MHD_quiesce_daemon:
#define MHD_itc_activate_(itc, str) ((write((itc).fd,(constvoid*)&_MHD_itc_wr_data,sizeof(_MHD_itc_wr_data))>0)||(EAGAIN==errno))
...
#define MHD_ITC_IS_VALID_(itc) (-1!=((itc).fd))
...
#define MHD_D_IS_USING_THREADS_(d) (0!=(d->options&(MHD_USE_INTERNAL_POLLING_THREAD)))
...
#define MHD_D_IS_USING_EPOLL_(d) (0!=((d)->options&MHD_USE_EPOLL))
...
#define MHD_PANIC(msg) do{mhd_panic(mhd_panic_cls,__FILE__,__LINE__,msg);BUILTIN_NOT_REACHED;}while(0)
...
void
MHD_DLOG (const struct MHD_Daemon *daemon,
          const char *format,
          ...)
{
  va_list va;

  if (0 == (daemon->options & MHD_USE_ERROR_LOG))
    return;
  va_start (va, format);
  daemon->custom_error_log (daemon->custom_error_log_cls,
                            format,
                            va);
  va_end (va);
}
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: I inspected the provided function MHD_quiesce_daemon and the related macro and function definitions. There are no occurrences of memcmp in the target code or in the supplied macros (MHD_itc_activate_ uses write, MHD_ITC_IS_VALID_ compares an integer fd, MHD_D_IS_USING_* macros test option bits, etc.). No other string-comparison operations (e.g., strcmp or explicit byte-wise comparisons of null-terminated strings using memcmp) appear in the shown code. Therefore there are no code fragments here that violate MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.14 (using memcmp to compare null-terminated strings). If memcmp usage exists elsewhere in the project, it was not present in the supplied code and would need to be checked in those files.
